fluff.name: Warlord
entries: Someone that steps up and leads can come from any background, and what style of leadership they bring can vary greatly. History is dotted with the most unlikely individuals gathering support and exercising their sway to gain militant, economic and regional control because they had the special quality that brought those to rally around them.

As stated the single most defining trait shared amongst these peoples is their ability to bring out the best from those who follow them. The warlord can embody a legendary battlefield commander whose name is passed on through the generations, and stories of their conquests are spoken with awe. It takes time to build up such renown, derived from physical training, combat intuition, focused ambition, strategic savvy and the relentless pursuit of victory.

What a warlord is might on the surface appear different but aspects can be seen in a former army official to a tactical genius to a grizzled veteran to a charismatic gangboss. When the order is given, few question the warlord. As they share their insight, ambition, and might with those who gather with them to prevail in war and conflict. To know the leadership of such a person is to know that they need not believe in themselves, but to believe in the warlord that believes in them.

classFeature.name: Merit
entries: At 1st level, you are able to recognize the quality of being particularly good or worthy of those around you. You have a pool of Merit dice represented by a number of d6s equal to your warlord level. Certain warlord features require you to expend these Merit dice. You regain your expended Merit dice when you finish a long rest.
Your Merit die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a d8 at 5th level, a d10 at 10th level, and a d12 at 15th level.

classFeature.name: Bravura
entries: When you or a creature who can see or hear you within 30 feet of you makes an ability check at disadvantage, you can use your reaction to roll a Merit die and add it to the result (this does not expend the Merit die). You can wait until after the d20 is rolled before deciding to use this feature, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.

The creature does not need disadvantage if it engages in an opposed ability check (or opposed roll at your DM's discretion). This can include, but is not limited to: Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) vs Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) to see a letter being passed off, Strength ({@skill Athletics}) vs Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) to escape a grapple, or Charisma ({@skill Deception}) vs Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) to bluff your way out of danger.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. Any time before you regain the use of this feature, if a creature rolls a 6 or higher on a Merit die that you have expended, you then regain the use of this feature.

classFeature.name: Strike Like Iron
entries: Starting at 1st level, your attacks help to point out the flaws in an enemy's defenses. Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you can expend a Merit die and place it on the target for up to 1 minute or until your {@status concentration|phb} ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). If a creature misses with an attack roll against the target you hit they can roll this Merit die, and on a 6 or higher the attack instead hits, regardless of the original roll. You may only have one Merit die placed in this way at a time.
If an attack hits as a result of your Strike like Iron the Merit die on the target is consumed and your {@status concentration|phb} ends.

classFeature.name: Moment of Courage
entries: At 2nd level, you can inspire allies to fight on courageously. As a bonus action, you can choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you and spend a number of Merit dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Roll the spent Merit dice and add them together. The target regains hit points equal to the total. The target can also spend a Hit Die for each Merit die spent to further increase the health restored to them.

classFeature.name: Warlord's Presence
entries: At 2nd level, you choose one of four archetypes that expresses your leadership style: Battlefront Marshal, Icon of Victory, Tactician, or Warbrave. All are detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: {@i 2nd-level {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional warlord feature}}
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again

classFeature.name: Spotter's Order
entries: Once you reach 3rd level, as an action you can target one ally you can see within 30 feet of you. If the target can see and hear you, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

classFeature.name: Megaboss
entries: {@i 3rd-level {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional warlord feature}}

As you strive for excellence you harness your potential as a capable leader. When you have no Merit die remaining, you can use your bonus action to regain a number of Merit die equal to your proficiency bonus.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Respite
entries: Beginning at 4th level, rest does not interfere with your desire to achieve your goals. You and any allies that can see or hear you within 60 feet are able to take a short rest, needing only 10 minutes to do so. At the end of this rest, any creature that benefits from this rest can reduce their {@condition exhaustion} by one level.

Additionally, you can restore a number of spent Hit Dice equal to twice your proficiency bonus, divided as you choose among any number of creatures that took part in this rest. Hit Dice gained as a result of your Respite can be spent immediately at the end of this short rest.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Tireless Leader
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can now use your Spotter's Order as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Command Style
entries: Once you reach 7th level, you can shape the battlefield as you see fit through Command Styles. You can prepare one Command Style of your choice. You can change your prepared Command Style after finishing a long rest or a Respite.

entries.name: Ambition Through Conflict
entries: When you use a warlord feature as a bonus action and are wielding a weapon in each hand, you may make a single weapon attack as part of the same bonus action dealing bonus damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0). An Icon of Victory is able to use their shield in place of a weapon for the purpose of this Command Style.
Additionally, whenever a creature succeeds an opposed ability check with your Bravura you regain use of it.

entries.name: Combat Dilation
entries: When you roll initiative, you can choose a number of creatures that can see or hear you within 60 feet of you, up to a number equal to half your warlord level. Reduce their initiative rolls by your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
Additionally, if a hostile creature makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw at disadvantage while you are within 5 feet of it, they roll an additional die and must take the lowest.

entries.name: Cry Havoc
entries: When a creature hits as a result of your Spotter's Order they deal extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) and you can expend a Merit die to place it on their target as if through your Strike like Iron. You must have a Merit die available to be placed in this way. Merit dice placed in this way do not require your {@status concentration|phb} to be maintained.

entries.name: Daedalus
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of you hits as a result of your Strike like Iron you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack. The attack must be made within range of your weapon. If you hit with this attack you deal extra damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0).

entries.name: Feed the Pack
entries: When a 6 or higher is rolled on one of your Merit die, you gain an additional attack that can be used on your turn when you take the {@action Attack} action. You can have a maximum number of additional attacks equal to your proficiency bonus, and you cannot gain one while at your maximum. You may only use one additional attack per turn. You lose these additional attacks after 1 minute if you do not use them.

Additionally, yourself and up to your proficiency bonus number of creatures that complete a Respite gain temporary hit points equal to half your warlord level + your Charisma modifier if this is your chosen Command Style at the end of the rest.

entries.name: General's Bearing
entries: When a creature with one of your Merit dice placed on it is reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to maintain {@status concentration|phb} on it for use on your next turn. Before the end of your next turn, if you hit another creature with a weapon attack, you may choose to place a Merit die on them as through your Strike Like Iron without expending an additional Merit die.

Additionally, while you concentrate on your Strike Like Iron, creatures of your choice that start their turn within 10 feet of you benefit from your Veteran Scars until the start of their next turn as long as you are not incapacitated.

entries.name: Grudge Keeper
entries: You have advantage on {@status concentration|phb} checks to maintain your Strike Like Iron.

Additionally, if you lose {@status concentration|phb} on your Strike like Iron as a result of taking damage from a creature, you can use your reaction to move up to your speed toward an enemy of your choice that you can see or hear. If you end your movement within reach of your melee weapon you can make one weapon attack as part of the same reaction. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Pile It On
entries: When using your Strike Like Iron, you can place a number of Merit dice on the target up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
If an enemy creature you can see takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action, you can use your reaction to command an ally to make an attack on the enemy creature per your Spotter's Order.

entries.name: Relentless Discipline
entries: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with an attack, or a creature that you are concentrating your Strike Like Iron on is reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose one creature within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you and grant them a special action on their next turn. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

entries.name: Strength of the Host
entries: When an allied creature you can see or hear within 30 feet of you uses their reaction, you can spend your reaction to allow that creature to take an additional reaction before the start of their next turn.
Additionally, the target of your Spotter's Order can move up to their speed as part of their reaction.

entries.name: Tip the Scales
entries: A creature that is the target of your Moment of Courage or Spotter's Order gains temporary hit points equal to half your warlord level.
Additionally, creatures you choose for your Consummate Command can move up to their speed, ignoring difficult terrain as part of the same reaction.

entries.name: Unyielding Will
entries: The target of your Moment of Courage can roll d4s instead of using Hit Dice to further increase the health restored to them.
Additionally, when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with your Moment of Courage to a creature at 0 hit points, they instead use the highest number possible for each die.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Veteran Scars
entries: At 9th level, your body and mind are shaped by your resolve through the conflicts you have endured. You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would impose a condition on you (at your DM's discretion), such as traps and spells.

classFeature.name: Consummate Command
entries: Once you reach 10th level, your flair is shared amongst those who follow your command. When initiative is rolled a number of creatures of your choice equal to your Charisma modifier within 60 feet of you can use their reaction to take a bonus action.
Some examples might be a Barbarian's Rage, a Monk spending Ki Points for Patient Defense, a Sorcerer converting Sorcery Points, or a Bard giving a Bardic Inspiration
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest or a Respite.

classFeature.name: Hedonist Insight
entries: Once you reach 11th level, when you roll initiative you can regain a number of Merit dice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), but you cannot exceed your maximum number based on your warlord level.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Instinctive Leader
entries: Starting at 13th level, the target of your Spotter's Order makes their attack roll at advantage.

classFeature.name: Overwhelming Odds
entries: Starting at 15th level, you care little about the odds. When you use your Moment of Courage you can affect a number of creatures of your choice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) as long as they are within 60 feet and you can see them.

Roll a number of Merit dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) and add them together. This total represents an amount of hit points that can be divided as you choose among any number of your affected targets. Each affected target can spend a Hit Die for each Merit die spent.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest or a Respite.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Grand Stratagem
entries: {@i 16th-level {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional warlord feature}}
Achieving an end is always within reach. Your warlord features that normally have a range of 30 feet are increased to 60 feet.

classFeature.name: Meritborne
entries: Starting at 17th level, your encouragement pushes your allies even further. When you or a creature rolls one or more of your Merit die, instead roll two and take the result of your choice.

classFeature.name: Press the Advantage
entries: Upon reaching 18th level, when you are given an inch you take a mile. Whenever a friendly creature that can see or hear you has advantage on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they can reroll one of the dice once. You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Warlord's Favor
entries: At 20th level, your favor can break limitations. When you take a Respite it takes 1 minute to complete and, a number of creatures of your choice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) benefiting from this Respite may regain the use of a feature of their choice which would normally require completing a long rest. This feature may not be applied to regain Warlord's Favor or spell slots of any kind.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Battlefront Marshal
entries: You might prefer warfare that is irregular in which you command small groups utilizing ambushes, sabotage and hit-and-run tactics. Mustering troops quickly and coordinated attacks help you press the advantage that you have created for you and your allies. You do not sly away large scale conflict but rather shape, mold, and dominate it.

subclassFeature.name: Muster for Battle
entries: At 2nd level when you choose this presence, you bring shock and awe. When you roll initiative, choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These creatures may double their proficiency bonus against creatures that haven't acted in the encounter yet.

subclassFeature.name: Tempered Hand
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that is no more than one size category larger than you, you can move the creature 5 feet in a direction of your choice to an unoccupied space (this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity). If this movement would force the creature into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit, they must succeed a Strength saving throw
to not move instead. When you move the target in this way you can move 5 feet in the same direction as part of the attack without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Alternatively, if the creature you hit is larger than you by more than one size category you can move 5 feet around the target to an unoccupied space without provoking attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Marshal
entries: At 10th level, you learn to harness your presence on the battlefield to inspire greatness from others. As a bonus action, you unleash a battle cry that sways the outcome of conflict. Up to ten other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear you double their proficiency bonus until the start of your next turn.
Additionally, the creatures you chose can make attacks of opportunity against creatures that you move using your Tempered Hand.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dominant Command
entries: Starting at 14th level, you mold yourself for conquest. You can prepare two Command Styles of your choice rather than one. You can change one or both of your prepared Command Styles when you finish a long rest or during a Respite.
Additionally, when initiative is rolled you may choose to change one of your Command Styles. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Icon of Victory
entries: Your presence on the battlefield cannot be ignored. You stand as a beacon of resolve and a symbol of glory. Your profession is war. Your armor makes you an indomitable force which helps your troops as they stand invincible against the enemy and proceed indubitably.

subclassFeature.name: Artisan of War
entries: At 2nd level when you choose this presence, you have committed yourself to a life of war. You gain proficiency with heavy armor and when wielding a weapon with the versatile property in one hand you can roll the weapon's damage as if you were wielding it with two hands.

Additionally, while you are wielding a shield and a 6 or higher is rolled on one of your Merit dice you can choose to make a melee weapon attack with your shield when you take one of the following actions before the end of your next turn: {@action Attack}, {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge} or {@action Use an Object}.

You are proficient with attacks using your shield. These attacks use your strength, and deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on a hit. If the shield is magical, then the attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: For Glory
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you move towards glory. While you are wearing medium or heavy armor you can use your Charisma modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier when rolling initiative.
Additionally, standing from prone, mounting and dismounting a creature only costs you 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Indomitable Inspiration
entries: When you reach 10th level, you are a beacon of resolve. The target of your Moment of Courage can expend one additional Hit Die to further increase the healing and has advantage on all saving throws until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Stand Invincible
entries: At 14th level, those who you command cannot be ignored. As a reaction when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points and is not killed outright, you can spend a Merit die to allow them to drop to 1 hit point instead and they can immediately spend a number of their Hit Dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to regain hit points. If they are prone they can immediately rise to their feet (costing no movement).

Alternatively, if that ally takes damage that would outright kill them, you can spend your reaction to instead reduce them to 0 hit points. That ally has disadvantage on death saving throws until stabilized or dead.
Once a creature benefits from this feature, they cannot benefit from it again until they complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tactician
entries: You are a master of planning and execution. The actions and commands you give are always calculated to achieve the most ideal result. You can manipulate any situation to be advantageous: from your small band of fighters to the mighty legions who follow you. You influence the battle with your guile and always have a cunning ploy.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Approach
entries: At 2nd level when you choose this presence, you apply your wit to control the field of battle as well as social interactions. You can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Charisma modifier for all your warlord features, and you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Religion} or a language of your choice.

Furthermore, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Wisdom modifier or Charisma modifier when making Wisdom or Charisma checks. You may do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Field Control
entries: Starting at 6th level, you have come to recognize the flow of battle is malleable. Your Moment of Courage allows the target to use their reaction to immediately rise to their feet if prone (costing no movement) and they can take the {@action Disengage} action moving up to half their current speed.

subclassFeature.name: Guile
entries: When you reach 10th level, your mind is as sharp as many of the weapons you wield. You gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws. After a long rest, the first time you use a warlord feature that can be regained from a rest benefiting from your Respite, or that allows you to regain expended Merit dice, you can choose not to expend the use of the feature.
Additionally, when using your Tactical Approach you can now use your Intelligence modifier in place of any modifier for an ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Cunning Ploy
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your plans are steps ahead of your opposition. When a 6 or higher is rolled on one of your Merit dice, you can use your reaction to target a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see and grant them an additional turn immediately after their next turn if they are conscious.
Once you use this feature, you must take a long rest or a Respite before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Warbrave
entries: You rush headstrong into the vanguard. Some might consider you brash, fighting shoulder to shoulder with your men. Your armor is worn, your body is scarred, and your enemies shake at your ferocity. All come to respect you.

subclassFeature.name: Into the Vanguard
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you are eager to be on the frontlines.

When you roll initiative you can gain temporary hit points by expending a Hit Die. Roll the die, and if it is less than your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) you may choose to use this instead. You gain temporary hit points equal to double that number.
Moreover, when the target of your Moment of Courage expends one or more of its Hit Dice they can choose to gain temporary hit points rather than regaining hit points for one Hit Die.
Additionally, you can add your Charisma modifier to @{status concentration|phb} checks made to maintain {@status concentration|phb} on your Strike like Iron.

subclassFeature.name: Forced Respect
entries: At 6th level, all shall come to respect you, one way or another. When an enemy within 10 feet of you attacks a creature other than you that you can see or hear with an attack or harmful spell, you may spend your reaction to make the enemy roll a Wisdom saving throw
On a failed save, the enemy must choose you as the new target or lose the attack or spell. The effect doesn't protect from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
Furthermore, you have resistance to any damage received as a result of this attack or spell.

subclassFeature.name: Brash Valor
entries: Starting at 10th level, you have a knack for provoking your foes into overextension. When you take damage as a result of your Forced Respect the attacker takes force damage equal to your warlord level. You can expend a number of Merit dice, up to your Charisma modifier, to deal additional force damage to the target. Roll the Merit dice and the damage is equal to the roll's total. Doing so allows you to place one of the expended Merit dice on the target as if it was the target of your Strike like Iron. Merit dice placed in this way do not require your {@status concentration|phb} to be maintained.

subclassFeature.name: Crescendo of Violence
entries: At 14th level, when you roll initiative you can release a warcry that fuels your allies and wreaks your foes with dread. You and a number of additional creatures of your choice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) within 30 feet of you can spend one Hit Die to gain temporary hit points as with your Into the Vanguard. Additionally, for 1 minute you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Forced Respect range increases to 30 feet.
Whenever a creature successfully saves against your Forced Respect during this time, they must reroll the save at disadvantage.
Any feature that requires a threshold to be met when rolling your Merit die has that threshold reduced by one.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest or a Respite before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Magus Chief
entries: You do not fight with iron and steel alone. You are steeped in a tradition that blends martial prowess with the esoteric arts. You stride through war-torn lands often occupied by mages and priests as well as soldiers. Firmly practiced, and focused you bolster practitioners of magic while picking up on some of their secrets for yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Pursuits
entries: At 2nd level when you choose this presence, you gain the ability to cast spells to further your influence based on the Magical Pursuits you focus on. See Spells Rules in the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting and then pick one of the pursuits listed below.

While you are concentrating on a spell from your chosen Magical Pursuit or from Pursuit of Charismata you can expend one Merit dice and place it when you hit a target with an attack or warlord spell is if it was the target of your Strike like Iron. Merit dice placed in this way do not require your concentration to be maintained. You can have a maximum number of Merit dice placed in this way equal to the spell level you are concentrating on.

entries.name: Mystic Pursuits
entries: You have chosen to weave arcane magic in with your martial prowess, having studied with scholars and mages alike. Your spell list for your Magical Pursuits is the wizard spell list.

entries.name: Pursuing Divinity
entries: You have witnessed the impact of faith take form in self-sacrifice as well as zealous retribution. Your spell list for your Magical Pursuits is the cleric and paladin spell lists.

entries.name: Pursuit of Balance
entries: You understand that conflict is a part of nature which is both nurturing and cruel. Your spell list for your Magical Pursuits is the druid and ranger spell lists.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from your Magical Pursuits spell list. You learn an additional cantrip at 6th level in this class, and again at 14th level in this class.

Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class's Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from your Magical Pursuits list

subclassFeature.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Magus Chief Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Magical Pursuits spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell shield and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast shield using either slot.

subclassFeature.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level Magical Pursuits spells of your choice, which you must choose from the enchantment and transmutation spells on your spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Magus Chief Spellcasting table shows when you learn more of your Magical Pursuits spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an enchantment or transmutation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

entries.name: Pursuit of Charismata
entries: The spells you learn at 3rd, 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic, and in addition to your Magical Pursuits spell list, you may also choose from the bard, sorcerer or warlock spell list.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of your Magical Pursuits spells you know with another spell of your choice from your Magical Pursuits spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an enchantment or transmutation spell, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic or appropriate spell listings.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Magical Pursuits spells, since you learn your spells through your training to best utilize magical practices in your strategies. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a chosen class spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Order
entries: Starting at 6th level, you guide the hand of magic. The target of your Spotter's Order can cast a cantrip at their target, rather than making a weapon attack. The cantrip must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only one creature.
Moreover, when you take the Attack action you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Catechism of Magic
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your influence and skill hinders your enemies. When a creature you can see or hear within 30 feet of you succeeds on a saving throw, you can use your Bravura to reduce it. Roll the Merit die. The creature must subtract the number rolled from the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Confluence of Focus
entries: At 14th level, your prowess has converged into unmatched focus for you and your allies. You add your Charisma modifier to the damage you deal with any warlord cantrip or warlord spell.
Additionally, the target of your Spotter's Order can cast a spell, rather than making a weapon attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only one creature.

subclass.name: Magus Chief
subclassFeatures: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher|Warlord|MateriaSourceOfTruth|Magus Chief|MateriaSourceOfTruth|2

spell.name: Druidcraft
entries: Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range:

items: You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
You create an instantaneous, harmless visual effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of smoke, or a tiny animal, the effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You can influence nonmagical weather events such as rain, snow or wind to move around you, preventing you from being affected by them for the next 10 minutes
You create a cacophony of animal sounds, winds rushing through trees, or the sounds of distant inclimate weather in a 10 foot cube within range
You may create a mild odor of plants within a 10 foot cube within range, whether the smell of fresh flowers, rotting vegetation, or otherwise

spell.name: Friends
entries: For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature prone to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM's discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it. The verbal component of this spell may be slipped into casual conversation. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check (made with advantage) allows a listener to determine that a spell has been cast.

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d10} poison damage and suffer the {@condition poisoned} condition until the beginning of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Produce Flame
entries: A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame when you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d10} fire damage. When you do so, another flame appears instantaneously in your hand if you wish it to do so, otherwise the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Resistance

components.m: a miniature cloak

entries: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the saving throw.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you touch. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} lightning damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. If the creature succeeds on the saving throw it takes no damage, but cannot take opportunity attacks against you until the end of your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Spectral Hand
entries: You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.
If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: True Strike

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. Your magic grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses and you gain advantage on the attack roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the weapon attack deals an extra {@dice 1d6} of the same type dealt by the weapon to a hit. This extra damage increases at 11th level ({@dice 2d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 3d6}).

spell.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell causes disadvantage on the next 2 attacks when you reach 5th level and deals an additional d4 damage ({@dice 2d4}), the next 3 attacks at 11th level and deals an additional d4 damage ({@dice 3d4}), and the next 4 attacks at 17th level and deals an additional d4 damage ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Arms of Hadar
entries: You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage and can't take reactions until its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Burning Hands
entries: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 2d8} plus your spellcasting modifier fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Charm Person
entries: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you and your companions as friendly acquaintances. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Chromatic Orb
entries: You hurl a 4-inch-diameter sphere of energy at a creature that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the type of orb you create, and then make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@dice 2d12} + your spellcasting ability modifier damage of the type you chose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Color Spray

components.m: a pinch of powder or sand that is colored red, yellow, and blue

entries: A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll {@dice 6d10}; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures in a 15-foot cone originating from you are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring {@condition unconscious} creatures and creatures that can't see).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional {@dice 2d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cure Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Divine Favor
entries: Your prayer empowers you with divine radiance. Until the spell ends, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d6} radiant damage on a hit.

spell.name: Expeditious Retreat
entries: This spell allows you to move at an incredible pace away from your enemies. When you cast this spell, and then as a bonus action on each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take the {@action Dash} action. On the turn you cast this spell, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

spell.name: Goodberry

components.m: a sprig of mistletoe or other berry plant, which the spell consumes

entries: Up to ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. Eating or administering a berry takes an action. Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Hail of Thorns
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack before the spell ends, this spell creates a rain of thorns that sprouts from your ranged weapon or ammunition. In addition to the normal effect of the attack, the target of the attack and each creature within 5 feet of it takes {@dice 1d10} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st (to a maximum of {@dice 6d10}).

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

entries: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@dice 1d12} + your spellcasting ability modifier fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Identify

components.m: an owl feather

entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other magic-imbued object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any.  You learn whether any spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it. If the object requires attunement, you may attune to it immediately. This spell cannot detect a curse within a magic item.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Illusory Script

components.m: a bottle of ink

entries: You write on parchment, paper, or some other suitable writing material and imbue it with a potent illusion that lasts for the duration.

To you and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell, the writing appears normal, written in your hand, and conveys whatever meaning you intended when you wrote the text. To all others, the writing is invisible. Alternatively, you can cause the writing to appear to be an entirely different message, written in a different hand and language, though the language must be one you know.
Should the spell be dispelled, the original script and the illusion both disappear.
A creature with {@sense truesight} can read the hidden message.

spell.name: Jump

components.m: a grasshopper's hind leg

entries: You touch a creature. The creature's jump distance is tripled until the spell ends and their jumping distance is not reduced for making a standing long or high jumps.

spell.name: Protection from Evil and Good

components.m: holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also cannot be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by them. If the target is already {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, if the creature you target with this spell is yourself, you emit an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with the creature, centered on the creature. Each non-hostile creature in the aura (including you) gains the spells benefits.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range and explodes in a nauseous gas upon impact. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 2d8} poison damage. The target of the attack and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Searing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon flares with white-hot intensity, exploding in searing heat when you strike, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier in fire damage to the target, and the searing heat erupts to creatures of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it inflicting your spellcasting ability modifier in fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage dealt to the initial target by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot.

spell.name: Silvery Barbs

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

entries: You magically distract the triggering creature and turn its momentary uncertainty into encouragement for another creature. The triggering creature must reroll the d20 and use the lower roll.

You can then choose a different creature you can see within range (you can choose yourself). The chosen creature has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute. A creature can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}, and if you choose, is knocked 10 feet away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot.

spell.name: Witch Bolt

components.m: a twig from a tree that has been struck by lightning

entries: A beam of crackling, blue energy lances out toward a creature within range, forming a sustained arc of lightning between you and the target. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 1d8} lightning damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier and it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save its speed is reduced to 0 until the spell ends. On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to deal {@dice 1d8} lightning damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier to the target automatically. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The spell also ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Acid Arrow

components.m: powdered rhubarb leaf and an adder's stomach

entries: A shimmering green arrow streaks toward a target within range and bursts in a spray of acid. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 8d4} acid damage immediately and {@dice 4d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a miss, the arrow splashes the target with acid for half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Barkskin

components.m: a handful of oak bark

entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, the bark like skin is treated as armor, which the target is considered proficient in, providing AC 15 plus their dexterity modifier up to +2.

spell.name: Borrowed Knowledge

components.m: a book worth at least 25 gp

entries: You draw on knowledge from spirits of the past. Choose one skill or tool in which you lack proficiency. For the spell's duration, you have proficiency in the chosen skill or tool. The spell ends early if you cast it again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th to 5th level, you gain an additional skill or tool in which you lack proficiency.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the duration does not require {@status concentration|phb}.
When you cast this spell using a slot of 7th or 8th level, you gain expertise in a skill or tool you have proficiency with.
When you cast this spell using a slot of 9th level, you gain expertise in all skill or tool you have proficiency with, and the duration is 8 hours.

spell.name: Branding Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra {@dice 2d8} radiant damage to the target, which becomes visible if it is {@status invisible}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become {@status invisible|phb} until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cordon of Arrows

components.m: four or more arrows or bolts

entries: You plant four pieces of nonmagical ammunition - {@item arrow|phb|arrows} or {@item crossbow bolt|phb|crossbow bolts} - in the ground within range and lay magic upon them to protect an area. Until the spell ends, whenever a creature other than you comes within 30 feet of the ammunition for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there, one piece of ammunition flies up to strike it. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting ability modifier piercing damage. The piece of ammunition is then destroyed. The spell ends when no ammunition remains.
When you cast this spell, you can designate any creatures you choose, and the spell ignores them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of ammunition that can be affected increases by two for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One humanoid of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, a twisted crown of jagged iron appears on its head, and a madness glows in its eyes.

At the beginning of the {@condition charmed} target's turn, you may either command the target to spend its action to make a weapon attack against a creature other than itself, or command it to move up to its speed in a direction of your choice. The target follows your command before doing anything else on its turn. The target may act normally on its turn if you do not command it.
A target isn't compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit, but it will provoke opportunity attacks to move in the designated direction.

On your subsequent turns, you must use your action to maintain control over the target, or the spell ends. Also, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the target deals bonus damage with weapon attacks against a creature other than itself equal to your spellcasting modifier.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the target makes its weapon attack rolls with advantage against a creature other than itself.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the spell no longer requires your concentration.

spell.name: Dust Devil

components.m: a pinch of dust

entries: Choose an unoccupied 5-foot cube of air that you can see within range. An elemental force that resembles a dust devil appears in the cube and lasts for the spell's duration.

Any creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of the dust devil must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed.

As a bonus action, you can move the dust devil up to 30 feet in any direction. If the dust devil moves over sand, dust, loose dirt, or small gravel, it sucks up the material and forms a 10-foot-radius cloud of debris around itself that lasts until the start of your next turn. The cloud heavily obscures its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw.  If you or your companions are fighting a creature, it has advantage on the save. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} and has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks while {@condition charmed} in this way made to perceive any creature other than you until the spell ends or until the target can no longer hear you. The spell ends if you are {@condition incapacitated} or can no longer speak.

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: You sense the location of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the {@spell alarm} spell, a {@spell glyph of warding}, or a mechanical pit trap, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.
This spell reveals the location of traps, the location of the triggers of those traps, and the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you detect.

spell.name: Flame Blade

components.m: leaf of sumac

entries: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.
You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 3d6} fire damage.
The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level through 7th level, you may attack twice with the blade using your action on your turn. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may attack three times with the blade suing your action on your turn.

spell.name: Gentle Repose

components.m: a pinch of salt and one copper piece placed on each of the corpse's eyes, which must remain there for the duration

entries: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead. The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

spell.name: Locate Object

components.m: a forked twig

entries: Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction and distance to the object's location, as long as that object is within 5 miles of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you, as long as you have seen it up close - within 30 feet - at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.
This spell can't locate an object if any thickness of lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between you and the object.

spell.name: Magic Mouth

components.m: a small bit of honeycomb and jade dust worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You implant a message within an object in range, a message that is uttered when a trigger condition is met. Choose an object that you can see and that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. Then speak the message, which must be 25 words or less, though it can be delivered over as long as 10 minutes. Finally, determine the circumstance that will trigger the spell to deliver your message.

When that circumstance occurs, a magical mouth appears on the object and recites the message in your voice and at the same volume you spoke. If the object you chose has a mouth or something that looks like a mouth (for example, the mouth of a statue), the magical mouth appears there so that the words appear to come from the object's mouth. When you cast this spell, you can have the spell end after it delivers its message, or it can remain and repeat its message whenever the trigger occurs.

The triggering circumstance can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the object. For example, you could instruct the mouth to speak when any creature moves within 30 feet of the object or when a silver bell rings within 30 feet of it. The magic mouth ignores illusions, and an illusory effects never trigger a magic mouth on their own.

spell.name: Mind Spike
entries: You reach into the mind of one creature that you can see within range. Alternatively, you can utter a creature's name. If the named target is within range, it becomes the spell's target even if you can't see it. If the named target isn't within range, the spell dissipates without effect. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@dice 3d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target's location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target cannot become hidden from you, and if it's {@condition invisible}, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you know the target's location even if they are on a different plane of existence from you.
Using a spell slot of 9th level or higher grants a duration that does not require concentration.

spell.name: Nathair's Mischief

components.m: a piece of crust from an apple pie

entries: You fill a 20-foot cube you can see within range with fey and draconic magic. Roll on the Mischievous Surge table to determine the magical effect produced, and roll again at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. You can move the cube up to 10 feet before you roll.

entries.caption: Mischievous Surge
rows: The smell of apple pie fills the air, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you until the start of your next turn. A {@condition charmed} creature regards you and your companions as friendly acquaintances.

Bouquets of flowers appear all around, and each creature in the cube must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn as the flowers spray water in their faces.

Each creature in the cube must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or begin giggling until the start of your next turn. A giggling creature is {@condition incapacitated} and uses all its movement at the start of its turn to move in a random direction.
Drops of molasses hover in the cube, making it difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Prayer of Healing
entries: You incite a prayer that upon completion you have a pool of healing equal to {@dice 12d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier which you roll and add up. This pool of healing is then immediately used on up to six creatures of your choice within range to regain hit points. Any unused healing from the pool is lost. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
entries: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Warding Bond

components.m: a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration

entries: This spell wards a willing creature (other than yourself) you touch and creates a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures. You can also dismiss the spell as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th, 5th or 6th level, roll a {@dice d6} and on a 6 you take no damage instead of the same amount.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, roll a {@dice d6} and on a 5-6 you take no damage instead of the same amount.

spell.name: Zone of Truth
entries: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, an unwilling creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. If the target is willing, or if an unwilling creature fails their save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeded on their saving throw if they made one.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

spell.name: Blinding Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon flares with a bright light, and the attack deals an extra {@dice 3d8} radiant damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for one minute.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Call Lightning
entries: A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud).

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 3d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your bonus action to call down lightning in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Barrage

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You throw a nonmagical weapon or fire a piece of nonmagical ammunition into the air to create a cone of identical weapons that shoot forward and then disappear. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 5d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon or ammunition used as a component.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Daylight
entries: A 60-foot-radius sphere of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet. The light is sunlight.

If you chose a point on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the light shines from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the affected object with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the light.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

spell.name: Elemental Weapon
entries: A nonmagical weapon you touch becomes a magic weapon. For the duration, the weapon has a +1 bonus to attack rolls. When you attack with this weapon, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. It deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of the chosen type when it hits.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the bonus to attack rolls increases to +2 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d4}. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3 and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d4}.

spell.name: Feign Death

components.m: a pinch of graveyard dirt

entries: You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated}, and its speed drops to 0. The target has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or {@condition poisoned} when you cast the spell, or becomes diseased or {@condition poisoned} while under the spell's effect, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends. At the time of casting the spell, you may choose to have the target awaken in less than 24 hours, the duration is set at the casting of the spell.

spell.name: Gaseous Form

components.m: a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke

entries: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. An incorporeal creature isn't affected.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a flying speed of 10 feet. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has immunity to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, though it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces. The target can't fall and remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}.

While in the form of a misty cloud, the target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. The target can't attack or cast spells.

spell.name: Glyph of Warding

components.m: incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that later unleashes a magical effect. You inscribe it either on a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest) to conceal the glyph. The glyph can cover an area no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If the surface or object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly invisible and requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to be found.

You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the glyph, removing another object covering the glyph, approaching within a certain distance of the glyph, or manipulating the object on which the glyph is inscribed. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers include opening that object, approaching within a certain distance of the object, or seeing or reading the glyph. Once a glyph is triggered, this spell ends.

You can further refine the trigger so the spell activates only under certain circumstances or according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight), creature kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect aberrations or drow), or alignment. You can also set conditions for creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.
When you inscribe the glyph, choose explosive runes or a spell glyph.

entries.name: Explosive Runes
entries: When triggered, the glyph erupts with magical energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the glyph. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 5d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage on a failed saving throw (your choice when you create the glyph), or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spell Glyph
entries: You can store a prepared of 3rd level or lower in the glyph by casting it as part of creating the glyph. The spell must target a single creature or an area and have an effect that is detrimental to the target. The spell being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way. When the glyph is triggered, the stored spell is cast. If the spell has a target, it targets the creature that triggered the glyph. If the spell affects an area, the area is centered on that creature. If the spell summons hostile creatures or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack it. If the spell requires concentration, it lasts until the end of its full duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of an explosive runes glyph increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd. If you create a spell glyph, you can store any spell of up to the same level as the slot you use for the glyph of warding.

spell.name: Hunger of Hadar

components.m: a pickled octopus tentacle

entries: You open a gateway to the dark between the stars, a region infested with unknown horrors. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point with range and lasting for the duration. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are {@condition blinded}.

The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@dice 2d6} cold damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 2d6} acid damage as milky, otherworldly tentacles rub against it. A caster concentrating on this spell may see normally in the effect and is not {@condition blinded}. The caster may also move freely through the area as if it were not difficult terrain and takes no damage from the effect.

spell.name: Life Transference
entries: You sacrifice some of your health to mend another creature's injuries. You take {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage you take plus your spellcasting modifier.
